info.title: Websocket Subscription Schemas
info.description: Schema definitions Websocket API subscriptions for Thalex exchange.

trades.description:
List of `[price, amount, direction, timestamp, implied_taker]`. Note that the snapshot of this feed may contain
older trades that happened since the last restart of the gateway.

The `implied_taker` is a boolean flag, set to `true` when the actual taker trade happened on another order book,
and the maker trade on this book is the result of implied matching.

Trades are not sent for combination order books.

bid_changes.description:
List of price level updates (price, amount, outright amount) for buy orders, amount 0 means level is now empty.

For combination order books, price and amount refer to the price and amount per unit of the combination.

ask_changes.description:
List of price level updates (price, amount, outright amount) for sell orders, amount 0 means level is now empty.

For combination order books, price and amount refer to the price and amount per unit of the combination.

total_bid_amount.description: The total amount of bid orders across all levels.

total_ask_amount.description: The total amount of ask orders across all levels.

time.description: Time of the last recorded update to this order book (Unix timestamp).

v.description:
Mark volatility.

Only included for options. Not included for combinations.

l.description:
Price of last trade (if any).

Not included for combinations.

RecentTrade.description:
item is an array with the following values: `[price, size, side ("buy" or "sell"), timestamp, instrument_name, implied_taker]`.

The `implied_taker` is a boolean flag, set to `true` when the actual taker trade happened on another order book,
and the maker trade on this book is the result of implied matching.

trade_volume_24h.description: Total amount traded in 24 hours, including futures and options.

option_volume_24h.description: Total amount of options traded in the past 24 hours.

delta_one_volume_24h.description: Total amount of futures traded in the past 24 hours.

trade_value_24h.description: Total underlying value traded in 24 hours. This is the sum of (amount * index price at time of trade).

option_value_24h.description: Total option value traded in 24 hours. This is the sum of (amount * index price at time of trade).

delta_one_value_24h.description: Total delta one value traded in 24 hours. This is the sum of (amount * index price at time of trade).

open_interest.description: Total count of outstanding contracts statistics.

expirations.description: Total count of outstanding contracts statistics per expiration date.

call.description: Total count of outstanding unsettled call options for the given expiration and underlying.

put.description: Total count of outstanding unsettled put options for the given expiration and underlying.

option.description: Total count of outstanding unsettled options for the given expiration and underlying.

future.description: Total count of outstanding unsettled future contracts for the given expiration and underlying.

call.description: Total count of outstanding unsettled call options for the given underlying.

put.description: Total count of outstanding unsettled put options for the given underlying.

option.description: Total count of outstanding unsettled options for the given underlying.

future.description: Total count of outstanding unsettled future contracts for the given underlying.

delta_one.description: Total count of outstanding unsettled delta one (future and perpetual) contracts for the given underlying.

timestamp.description: The unix timestamp when the index price was recorded in the database.

expiration_print_average.description: The average price so far over the current expiration, if any.

expiration_progress.description: A number between 0.0 and 1.0 indicating the progress of the current expiration.

expected_expiration_price.description:
If expiration is in progress, and the index price will not change any more, this
is the expiration price. Equals `expiration_progress * expiration_print_average + (1 - expiration_progress) * price`.

previous_settlement_price.description: The last known settlement price (expiration price, underlying delivery price).

RecentTrades.description:
Array of trades, each item is an array with the following values: `[price, size, side ("buy" or "sell"), timestamp, instrument_name, implied_taker]`.

The `implied_taker` is a boolean flag, set to `true` when the actual taker trade happened on another order book,
and the maker trade on this book is the result of implied matching.

index.description: Index price of the underlying of the instrument.

index_delta.description:
Before expiration, Thalex linearly scales the deltas of
the expiring instruments to zero, over a time window.
This number represents how far into this process the expiration is
(i.e. delta used for margining = index_delta * actual delta of the instrument).

components.description:
Components that were used in calculating the index price.
Code name of the source is mapped to its price.

min_order_amount.description:
Minimum order amount for this instrument. This value is always greater or equal to `volume_tick_size`.

If this value is greater than `volume_tick_size`, it is not possible to insert an order of a smaller amount,
or amend an existing order to a smaller amount. However, orders in the books can have smaller remaining
amounts as they get partially filled, down to the minimum of `volume_tick_size`.

legs.description: For combinations, array of objects with `instrument_name` and `quantity`.

settlement_price.description: For expired instruments, the final settlement price.

settlement_index_price.description: For expired instruments, the underlying delivery price.

valid_until.description: Timestamp at which this RFQ will be automatically cancelled (unix timestamp)

legs.description: Combo legs. A minimalised version of the request such that quantities are integer.

quantity.description: Quantity for this leg. May be negative.

fee_quantity.description: Quantity for fee calculations. Anywhere between 0 and abs(quantity).

label.description: User label set at creation. Not visibible to market makers.

insert_reason.description: Detailed reason for creation. Visible only to the requester.

delete_reason.description: Reason why this RFQ was removed. Visible only to the requester.

volume_tick_size.description: The minimum size / size increase for quotes.

quoted_bid.description: The bid price/amount quoted so far, if any. Visible only to the requester.

quoted_ask.description: The ask price/amount quoted so far, if any. Visible only to the requester.

trade_price.description: Combo price for which this RFQ was traded.

trade_amount.description: Amount in which this RFQ was traded.

close_time.description: Time at which this RFQ was cancelled or traded.

event.description: This field is set only on the `account.rfqs` subscription.

remaining_amount.description:
Remaining amount may be less than zero if a single aggressive order has
caused an overshoot. If remaining amount is less than or equal to zero, the
mass quote orders in the group will have been cancelled, and the group needs
refilling.

reason.description:
Detailed reason of the protection group status update.

The following reasons are possible:
- `refill`: Remaining amount was updated by the client, e.g. with a call to `private/set_mm_protection`.

- `executions`: Remaining amount was updated after a trade.

- `client_cancel`: Protection group was deleted by the client, e.g. with a call to `private/cancel_mass_quote`.

- `session_end`: Protection group was automatically deleted when a WebSocket session ended.

- `failover`: Protection group was automatically deleted on matching engine failover.

trades.description:
List of `[price, amount, direction, timestamp, implied_taker]`. Note that the snapshot of this feed may contain
older trades that happened since the last restart of the gateway.

The `implied_taker` is a boolean flag, set to `true` when the actual taker trade happened on another order book,
and the maker trade on this book is the result of implied matching.

Trades are not sent for combination order books.

bid_changes.description:
List of price level updates (price, amount, outright amount) for buy orders, amount 0 means level is now empty.

For combination order books, price and amount refer to the price and amount per unit of the combination.

ask_changes.description:
List of price level updates (price, amount, outright amount) for sell orders, amount 0 means level is now empty.

For combination order books, price and amount refer to the price and amount per unit of the combination.

total_bid_amount.description: The total amount of bid orders across all levels.

total_ask_amount.description: The total amount of ask orders across all levels.

time.description: Time of the last recorded update to this order book (Unix timestamp).

v.description:
Mark volatility.

Only included for options. Not included for combinations.

l.description:
Price of last trade (if any).

Not included for combinations.

RecentTradesPayload.description:
Array of trades, each item is an array with the following values: `[price, size, side ("buy" or "sell"), timestamp, instrument_name, implied_taker]`.

The `implied_taker` is a boolean flag, set to `true` when the actual taker trade happened on another order book,
and the maker trade on this book is the result of implied matching.

trade_volume_24h.description: Total amount traded in 24 hours, including futures and options.

option_volume_24h.description: Total amount of options traded in the past 24 hours.

delta_one_volume_24h.description: Total amount of futures traded in the past 24 hours.

trade_value_24h.description: Total underlying value traded in 24 hours. This is the sum of (amount * index price at time of trade).

option_value_24h.description: Total option value traded in 24 hours. This is the sum of (amount * index price at time of trade).

delta_one_value_24h.description: Total delta one value traded in 24 hours. This is the sum of (amount * index price at time of trade).

open_interest.description: Total count of outstanding contracts statistics.

expirations.description: Total count of outstanding contracts statistics per expiration date.

call.description: Total count of outstanding unsettled call options for the given expiration and underlying.

put.description: Total count of outstanding unsettled put options for the given expiration and underlying.

option.description: Total count of outstanding unsettled options for the given expiration and underlying.

future.description: Total count of outstanding unsettled future contracts for the given expiration and underlying.

call.description: Total count of outstanding unsettled call options for the given underlying.

put.description: Total count of outstanding unsettled put options for the given underlying.

option.description: Total count of outstanding unsettled options for the given underlying.

future.description: Total count of outstanding unsettled future contracts for the given underlying.

delta_one.description: Total count of outstanding unsettled delta one (future and perpetual) contracts for the given underlying.

index.description: Index price of the underlying of the instrument.

index_delta.description:
Before expiration, Thalex linearly scales the deltas of
the expiring instruments to zero, over a time window.
This number represents how far into this process the expiration is
(i.e. delta used for margining = index_delta * actual delta of the instrument).

components.description:
Components that were used in calculating the index price.
Code name of the source is mapped to its price.

order_id.description: Unique ID, use to identify in cancel

amount.description: Size of the order when activated

target.description: The trigger type that `stop_price` and `bracket_price` will refer to.

stop_price.description: Trigger price at which the order will be activated

limit_price.description: For stop limit order, the price at which the order will be placed

bracket_price.description: For bracket order, the price at which profit will be taken (upper activation price)

trailing_stop_callback_rate.description: For trailing stop loss, the callback rate as a ratio (e.g. 0.05 for 5%)

update_time.description: Time of last update (conversion or change of trailing stop price)

converted_order_id.description: System order ID of the created order.

order_id.description: System order ID, use to identify in amend/cancel, and to match trades.

instrument_name.description:
Order instrument name.

Not present for combination orders. Refer to `legs` field instead.

legs.description:
List of legs for this combination order.

Not present for single-leg orders. Refer to `instrument_name` field instead.

quantity.description: Quantity of this leg in a unit of the combination. A non-zero integer, negative for short legs.

filled_amount.description:
Amount executed on this leg.

Legs are filled proportionally to their quantities.

price.description:
Limit price. May be omitted if no price was supplied (e.g. for a market order).

For combination orders this specifies limit price per unit of the combination.

amount.description:
Order size (as inserted or amended to).

For combination orders this specifies the amount of units of the combination to trade.

filled_amount.description:
Part of the order that has been executed.

For combination orders this specifies the amount of units of the combination filled.
Legs are filled proportionally to their quantities.

label.description: Label supplied with insert. Can also be a number. Field is omitted if no label was supplied.

client_order_id.description: Client-supplied order id. Field is omitted if no client order id was supplied.

delete_reason.description:
Detailed reason of order deletion if the order was deleted, omitted otherwise.

The following reasons are possible:

- `client_cancel`: Order was cancelled by the client, e.g. with a call to `private/cancel`.

- `client_bulk_cancel`: Order was cancelled by the client with a bulk cancel call, e.g. `private/cancel_all`.

- `session_end`: Non-persistent order was automatically cancelled when a WebSocket session ended.

- `instrument_deactivated`: Order was automatically cancelled when the order instrument was deactivated,
  for example after expiration.

- `mm_protection`: Order was automatically cancelled when configured market maker protection amount was exhausted.

- `failover`: Non-persistent order was automatically cancelled on matching engine failover.

- `margin_breach`: Order was automatically cancelled in a response to a margin breach on the account as part
  of automatic liquidation procedures.

- `filled`: Order was filled in full.

- `immediate_cancel`: The order was submitted as "immediate-or-cancel" and was not filled in full immediately.
  Note that the order might be partially filled when this delete reason is set.

- `admin_cancel`: The order was cancelled by an exchange admin.

conditional_order_id.description:
If the order was triggered by a conditional order (stop order), the ID of that conditional order.
Otherwise omitted.

bot_id.description:
If the order was inserted by a bot, the ID of that bot.
Otherwise omitted.

close_time.description: Time when this order was closed or canceled (Unix timestamp).

reduce_only.description: True if the order is a reduce only order, omitted otherwise.

position.description: Amount of this contract currently held; short positions are negative.

mark_price.description: Current mark price for the instrument.

iv.description: Implied volatility calculated at time of marking.

index.description: Index price at time of marking.

start_price.description:
Average price paid to obtain position.

Note: for instruments that are subject to daily futures-style settlement, the start price
is reset to the mark price at the end of each session and all the unrealized P&L is thus realized.
Use `private/daily_mark_history` API endpoint to get information about daily settlements.

average_price.description: Average price paid to obtain position. Doesn't reset at settlement.

unrealised_pnl.description:
Unrealised P&L in the current session for this position based on current mark price,
equal to `(mark_price - start_price) * position`.

Note: for instruments that are subject to daily futures-style settlement, the start price
is reset to the mark price at the end of each session and all the unrealized P&L is thus realized.
Use `private/daily_mark_history` API endpoint to get information about daily settlements.

realised_pnl.description:
Realized P&L in the current session.

Realized P&L is settled into a settlement asset at the end of each session.

entry_value.description: Total entry value, equal to `start_price * position`.

perpetual_funding_entry_value.description:
Entry mark value for perpetual funding.
Unrealised perpetual funding is (current perp funding mark * position) -
perpetual funding entry value. Not
included if zero.

unrealised_perpetual_funding.description:
For perpetual positions, current unrealized perpetual funding.

The funding is realized as P&L and settled into settlement asset at the end of each session.

client_order_id.description: Client-supplied order id. Field is omitted if no client order id was supplied.

trade_price.description: the price at which this order traded.

trade_amount.description: the number of combinations that traded.

event.description: This field is set only on subscriptions.

maker_taker.description: Maker (trade on book order) or taker (trade on new order), if applicable.

leg_index.description:
Index of a leg on which the trade happened for combination orders. Zero for single-leg orders.

For combination orders the direction of the trade is defined by the direction of the order and
the sign of the leg quantity.

cash_collateral.description: Total margin based on cash holdings.

margin.description: Total margin from unrealised P&L and cash holdings.

required_margin.description: Required margin based on current position.

remaining_margin.description: Difference between margin and required margin.

session_realised_pnl.description: Realised profit or loss in current session.

cash.description: List of cash holdings, for each relevant currency, and how they contribute to margin.

collateral_factor.description: The collateral quality of the asset i.e. the fraction of the asset that can be used as a collateral.

collateral_index_price.description:
Index price used to calculate collateral effect of this position.
Can be `null` for assets that are not converted using an index, e.g. for stable coins.

transactable.description: If this flag is `true`, this currency can be deposited and withdrawn.

best_bid_price.description: Price of the best (highest) bid in the orderbook, or `null` if the orderbook is empty.

best_bid_amount.description: Size of best bid, or `null` if the orderbook is empty.

best_ask_price.description: Price of best (lowest) ask in the orderbook, or `null` if the orderbook is empty.

best_ask_amount.description: Size of best ask, or `null` if the orderbook is empty.

last_price.description:
Price of last trade, or `null` if no trades have been registered yet.

Not included for combinations.

mark_timestamp.description: The unix timestamp when the price was marked.

iv.description:
Implied volatility calculated at time of marking.

Only included for options. Not included for combinations.

delta.description:
Delta calculated at time of marking.

Not included for combinations.

index.description: Index price at time of marking.

forward.description:
Forward price at time of marking.

Only included for options.

volume_24h.description:
Total volume traded over the last 24 hours.

Not included for combinations.

value_24h.description:
Total value traded over the last 24 hours.

Not included for combinations.

low_price_24h.description:
Lowest price in the last 24 hours.

Not included for combinations.

high_price_24h.description:
Highest price in the last 24 hours.

Not included for combinations.

change_24h.description:
Difference in price between the first and the last trades in the last 24 hours, `null` if there were no trades.

Not included for combinations.

collar_low.description: Current price collar low (checks new asks)

collar_high.description: Current price collar high (checks new bids)

open_interest.description:
Total number of outstanding unsettled contracts.

Not included for combinations.

funding_rate.description:
Current rate at which long position pays and short position earns, in funding interval.

Only included for perpetuals.

funding_mark.description:
Funding value of a single contract long position since last settlement.

Only included for perpetuals.

realised_funding_24h.description:
Total funding accumulated for a single contract long position over the last 24 hours.

Only included for perpetuals.

average_funding_rate_24h.description:
Average funding rate for the last 24 hours.

Only included for perpetuals.

notifications.description: List of notifications ordered from newest to oldest.

display_type.description: Specifies what style to use for notification display.

read.description: set to true if notification was marked as read.

account_name.description: Optional account name, only present if the notification is related to an account.

account_number.description: Optional account number only present if the notification is related to an account.

popup.description: User preference - show popup for this notification

notifications.title: Margin Requirements
notifications.message: Portfolio of account foo-123 breached initial margin requirements.

bot_id.description: Individually identifies this bot instance. You can use it to cancel this specific one.

stop_reason.description: The reason why the bot stopped executing. Possible values are ["client_cancel", "client_bulk_cancel", "end_time", "instrument_deactivated", "margin_breach", "admin_cancel", "conflict", "strategy"].

entry_price.description: Price to compare `signal` price to, to determine necessary adjustments to the portfolio. See [the bot strategies section](#tag/bot_strategies) for more explanation.

target_position.description: The target position to maintain in the subaccount if `signal` price is above `entry_price`. See [the bot strategies section](#tag/bot_strategies) for more explanation.

exit_price.description: Price to compare `signal` price to, to determine necessary adjustments to the portfolio. See [the bot strategies section](#tag/bot_strategies) for more explanation.

exit_position.description: The target position to maintain in the subaccount if `signal` price is below `exit_price`. See [the bot strategies section](#tag/bot_strategies) for more explanation.

max_slippage.description: Maximum slippage per trade, expressed as % of the traded instruments mark price.

end_time.description: Timestamp when the bot stops executing, cancelling its orders and leaving all positions of the subaccount intact.

label.description: A label that the bot will add to all orders for easy identification.

bot_id.description: Individually identifies this bot instance. You can use it to cancel this specific one.

stop_reason.description: The reason why the bot stopped executing. Possible values are ["client_cancel", "client_bulk_cancel", "end_time", "instrument_deactivated", "margin_breach", "admin_cancel", "conflict", "strategy"].

bid_offset.description: The offset of the price of the bid quote from the signal price. See [the bot strategies section](#tag/bot_strategies) for more explanation.

ask_offset.description: The offset of the price of the ask quote from the signal price. See [the bot strategies section](#tag/bot_strategies) for more explanation.

quote_size.description: The default size of both the bid and ask quote, See [the bot strategies section](#tag/bot_strategies) for more explanation.

min_position.description: The minimum portfolio position to maintain in the subaccount. See [the bot strategies section](#tag/bot_strategies) for more explanation.

max_position.description: The maximum portfolio position to maintain in the subaccount. See [the bot strategies section](#tag/bot_strategies) for more explanation.

end_time.description: Timestamp when the bot stops executing, cancelling its orders and leaving all positions of the subaccount intact.

label.description: A label that the bot will add to all orders for easy identification.

bot_id.description: Individually identifies this bot instance. You can use it to cancel this specific one.

stop_reason.description: The reason why the bot stopped executing. Possible values are ["client_cancel", "client_bulk_cancel", "end_time", "instrument_deactivated", "margin_breach", "admin_cancel", "conflict", "strategy"].

instrument_name.description: Name of the instrument the bot instance is trading.

bids.description: The default price levels the bot will be bidding at. See [the bot strategies section](#tag/bot_strategies) for more explanation.

asks.description: The default price levels the bot will be quoting on the ask side. See [the bot strategies section](#tag/bot_strategies) for more explanation.

target_mean_price.description: The price level to exit positions at.

step_size.description: The default size of to quote on one level. See [the bot strategies section](#tag/bot_strategies) for more explanation.

base_position.description: Will be used as a reference to compare the subaccount's portfolio position in the instrument that this bot is trading to. See [the bot strategies section](#tag/bot_strategies) for more explanation.

upside_exit_price.description: If the mark price of the instrument this bot is trading goes above `upside_exit_price`, the bot cancels the maker orders, aggressively trades into `base_position`, and then stops executing.

downside_exit_price.description: If the mark price of the instrument this bot is trading goes below `downside_exit_price`, the bot cancels the maker orders, aggressively trades into `base_position`, and then stops executing.

max_slippage.description: Maximum slippage per trade when exiting any position, expressed as % of the traded instruments mark price.

end_time.description: Timestamp when the bot stops executing, cancelling its orders and leaving all positions of the subaccount intact.

label.description: A label that the bot will add to all orders for easy identification.

bot_id.description: Individually identifies this bot instance. You can use it to cancel this specific one.

stop_reason.description: The reason why the bot stopped executing. Possible values are ["client_cancel", "client_bulk_cancel", "end_time", "instrument_deactivated", "margin_breach", "admin_cancel", "conflict", "strategy"].

instrument_name.description: Name of the instrument the bot instance is trading.

grid.description: The default price levels the bot will be quoting at. See [the bot strategies section](#tag/bot_strategies) for more explanation.

target_mean_price.description: As long as the account's portfolio position in the instrument that the bot is trading is equal to base_position, the bot will insert step_size asks on the grid above target_mean_price (one per level), and step_size bids below target_mean_price.

step_size.description: The default size to quote on one level. See [the bot strategies section](#tag/bot_strategies) for more explanation.

base_position.description: Will be used as a reference to compare the subaccount's portfolio position in the instrument that this bot is trading to. See [the bot strategies section](#tag/bot_strategies) for more explanation.

upside_exit_price.description: If the mark price of the instrument this bot is trading goes above `upside_exit_price`, the bot cancels the maker orders, aggressively trades into `base_position`, and then stops executing.

downside_exit_price.description: If the mark price of the instrument this bot is trading goes below `downside_exit_price`, the bot cancels the maker orders, aggressively trades into `base_position`, and then stops executing.

max_slippage.description: Maximum slippage per trade when exiting any position, expressed as % of the traded instruments mark price.

end_time.description: Timestamp when the bot stops executing, cancelling its orders and leaving all positions of the subaccount intact.

label.description: A label that the bot will add to all orders for easy identification.

instrument_name.description: Name of the instrument the bot will trade.

position.description: Name of an instrument. If specified, the bot will only hedge the position in this instrument, not the entire underlying.

target_delta.description: The delta that the bot is targeting.

period.description: Number of seconds to let the deltas stay outside of `[target-threshold, target+threshold]`, before hedging them.

max_slippage.description: Maximum slippage per trade, expressed as % of the traded instruments mark price.

end_time.description:
Timestamp when the bot should stop executing.
If not specified, the bot will run until it's manually stopped.
When `end_time` is reached, the bot will leave all positions intact, it will not open/close any of them.

label.description: A label that the bot will add to all orders for easy identification.

instrument_name.description: Name of the instrument to trade, in order to follow the deltas of the target.

target_instrument.description: Name of the option to follow the deltas of.

target_amount.description: Amount of `target_instrument` contracts to follow the deltas of.

period.description:
Number of seconds to let the deltas of the following position stay outside of `[target-threshold, target+threshold]`,
before correcting them, where `target = deltas of target_instrument * target_amount`.

max_slippage.description: Maximum slippage per trade, expressed as % of the traded instruments mark price.

end_time.description:
Timestamp when the bot should stop executing.
When `end_time` is reached, the bot will leave all positions intact, it will not open/close any of them.

label.description: A label that the bot will add to all orders for easy identification.

trade_type.description:
Type of the trade.

Note: as of API v2.31.0 we have stopped representing futures-style settlements as trades of `daily_mark` type. You might still
get such trades in the history, but no new trades of `daily_mark` type will be created.
To get information about daily marks, use `private/daily_mark_history` API endpoint.

position_after.description: Position in this instrument right after the trade.

session_realised_after.description: Session realised P&L for this instrument right after the trade.

position_pnl.description: If trade closed a position, the positional P&L that was realised.

perpetual_funding_pnl.description: If trade closed a position in a perpetual, the funding P&L that was realised.

fee.description:
The fee paid for this trade.

The fee for a trade is calculated as `fee_basis * fee_rate * amount`, and is then subject
to clamping to minimum and maximum fee. Depending on the instrument, `fee_basis` can be different
(e.g. it can be equal to the underlying index, trade price or combo mark price). Please
refer to trading information pages for more details.

index.description: The relevant index at time of trade.

fee_rate.description: The fee rate applied to calculate the fee.

fee_basis.description: The fee basis on which the fee is calculated.

funding_mark.description: The perpetual funding mark as applied to the trade (see `Ticker`).

liquidation_fee.description: Fee paid in case of liquidation.

client_order_id.description: Client order reference as set in related order.

maker_taker.description: Maker (trade on book order) or taker (trade on new order), if applicable.

bot_id.description:
If the trade was made by a bot, the ID of that bot.
Otherwise omitted.

leg_index.description:
Index of a leg on which the trade happened for combination orders. Zero for single-leg orders.

For combination orders the direction of the trade is defined by the direction of the order and
the sign of the leg quantity.

time.description: Time when this banner was posted (Unix timestamp).

severity.description: Severity of the banner message. Used to choose appropriate styling for banner display.

message.description: Message text to be displayed in the banner.

example.title: Important information
example.message: Starting next week we are lowering our fees by 10%.

event.description:
Type of the system event.

- `reconnect`: you receive this event when the WebSocket connection is about to be closed by the server and you need to open a new one. This can happen, for example, during exchange maintenance windows. The event is sent at least 10 seconds before the connection is closed.
